page.title: 01LONG MYND
page.content: The{Longmynd}is in south-east Shropshire.It is owned by the {National Trust}.It's a very marshy moorland area with bracken and heather.It is very cold with strong winds that wreck young trees.They also have a higher rainfall.There is only short grass for{rough grazing}.The farmers leave their sheep up there for the spring and summer,then bring them down in the autumn.There is a rough road that runs over the Longmynd and {tourists}can walk mainly where they want.There is a stream that runs right through the middle of it and through Church-Stretton.The Longmynd is one of Britains most beautiful parts of the country.
